title: What is the period of first generation computers? - Quora

response.answer_text: First generation computers were built using either relays or vacuum tubes. There were primarily built during the period 1940–1956. Some of their characteristics: They often took up entire roomsEarly ones were one-offs (Colossus, ENIAC, Manchester Mark I); only later were they mass-produced (UNIVAC, IBM 650, IBM 704)They had small memories (typically a few KB’s or less)Typically used punched cards for input and output; later ones used mag tape drives for long-term storageRan programs one at a time in batch modeWere slow (clock speeds of 1 MHz or less)
